com.att.research.xacml.api

Interface IdReferenceMatch

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DOMIdReferenceMatch, JaxpIdReferenceMatch, StdIdReferenceMatch

    public interface IdReferenceMatch
    Defines the API for objects that represent XACML PolicyIdReference or PolicySetIdReference elements with exact, earliest, and latest version matching.
    Version:
    $Revision: 1.1 $
    Author:
    Christopher A. Rath

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
      Implementations of the IdReferenceMatch interface must override the equals method with the following semantics: Two IdReferenceMatch objects (i1 and i2) are equal if: i1.getId().equals(i2.getId()) AND i1.getVersion() == null && i2.getVersion() == null OR i1.getVersion().equals(i2.getVersion()) i1.getEarliestVersion() == null && i2.getEarliestVersion() == null OR i1.getEarliestVersion().equals(i2.getEarliestVersion()) AND i1.getLatestVersion() == null && i2.getLatestVersion() == null OR i1.getLatestVersion().equals(i2.getLatestVersion())
      VersionMatch getEarliestVersion()
      Gets the VersionMatch representing a full or partial match against the earliest XACML Version string.
      Identifier getId()
      Returns the Identifier representing the XACML PolicyId or PolicySetId that is referenced by this IdReference.
      VersionMatch getLatestVersion()
      Gets the VersionMatch representing a full or partial match against the latest XACML Version string.
      VersionMatch getVersion()
      Gets the VersionMatch representing a full or partial match against a XACML Version string.

      • equals

        boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Implementations of the IdReferenceMatch interface must override the equals method with the following semantics: Two IdReferenceMatch objects (i1 and i2) are equal if: i1.getId().equals(i2.getId()) AND i1.getVersion() == null && i2.getVersion() == null OR i1.getVersion().equals(i2.getVersion()) i1.getEarliestVersion() == null && i2.getEarliestVersion() == null OR i1.getEarliestVersion().equals(i2.getEarliestVersion()) AND i1.getLatestVersion() == null && i2.getLatestVersion() == null OR i1.getLatestVersion().equals(i2.getLatestVersion())
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
